Key Match Events: The Mets lost Game 4 of the NLCS to the Dodgers with a score of 10-2
Mookie Betts hit a two-run homer in the sixth inning
Shohei Ohtani led off the game with a home run
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets trail the series 3-1 and will need to win three consecutive elimination games to advance
Post-Match Reflections: The Mets need to improve in every aspect to win the next game
Others: The Mets have been underdogs throughout the playoffs and have made several improbable comebacks
